snippet: More than a dozen states said Friday that they would not establish exchanges — online markets where consumers can shop for private insurance subsidized by the federal government.
abstract: More than a dozen states say that they will not establish exchanges, online markets where consumers can shop for private health insurance subsidized by federal government; several others say they will take advantage of extra month allowed by Obama administration to make decisions.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

lead_paragraph: More than a dozen states said Friday that they would not establish exchanges — online markets where consumers can shop for private insurance subsidized by the federal government.

headline.main: States Decline to Set Up Exchanges for Insurance
headline.print_headline: States Decline To Set Up Exchanges For Insurance

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
